content:
the prayer book my
mother gave me when I was 16. At the back were printed the Thirty-nine Arti-
cles of Religion which members of my church, the Episcopal Church, were ex-
pected  to  accept.  I  had  not  read  them  carefully  when  I  was  preparing  for
confirmation. Then I was only 13, and there was much I did not understand.
Our minister seemed to me a good man: highly intelligent, cultured, and hu-
mane. At 13, I was content to accept what he told me, simply on his authority.
Then, at 16,
